Mayor's Cup: Lesione Challenge Recap
Monster Rancher Metropolis: The Coliseum (Public Monster Rancher Tournaments): Archived Topics From Prior Years: MR3 Mayor's Cups: Mayor's Cup: Lesione Challenge Recap
By Velo on Sunday, October 20, 2002 - 07:18 pm:

Rolaids vs. Lisaione:

Round 1: Submerges went back and forth, but in the end Lisa's were more plentiful and more powerful, granting her a 54.1% to 12.5% win.

Round 2: Same story as round one, but this time Lisa did more damage. In fact, when all was done, Rolaids was only hanging on by one life point, losing 0.1% to 48.1%.

Round 3: Yet again, Lisa's abundance of submerges damaged Rolaids enough to make any attacks from Fen's monster moot points in the 57.0 to 16.3 win by Lisaione.

Lisaione 3, Rolaids 0

Lisaione vs. Lahas Jr.:

Round 1: There weren't two many attacks here, in fact the battle was won by only two submerge attacks. Unsurprisingly, these came from Lisa, who won 55.8 to 42.2

Round 2: This time, LJ unleashed several more attacks than he had in the previous round, and it seemed as if he was going to tie up[ the match. However, through a last minute tsunami, Lisa pulled off another win.

Round 3: This was a close one like round one. Lisa began with a trademark submerge, and LJ replied with a boomerang and a powerful tsunami. Not powerful enough however, as Lisaione was able to counter with a tail whip to win the round and the match 56.8 to 47.6

Lisaione 3, Lahas Jr. 0

Rolaids vs. Patsy:

Round 1: Rolaids did moderate damage with a tail whip and a submerge, but it was all undone when Patsy let go of her killer tsunami, netting her the first KO of the night.

Round 2: Patsy was even more overpowering in this round. He did not pull off a KO, but he was never hit and Rolaids was left trembling after a 23.3 to 100 loss.

Round 3: Yet again, Patsy was never hit, although this time ROlaids did better. Didn't matter anyway, Patsy won 100 to 72.

Patsy 3, Rolaids 0

Rolaids vs. Lahas Jr.:

Round 1: LJ dominated, using two submerges and a tsunami to get the second KO of the night.

Round 2: LJ got another tsunami, but Rolaids surprisingly came back with a flurry of submerges and show times, winning 35 to 17.5

Round 3: Rolaids, who seemed to be on an up for once in the night, managed to dodge every single attack that LJ made, winning 100 to 43.2

Round 4: Each competitor made only one move, but LJ's submerge was stronger than Rolaids', winning 73.6 to 65.1

Round 5: Submerges were flying back and forth in this exciting finale, and when the timer hit 0...Lahas was ahead by .1%, leaving Rolaids without a win for the night.

Lehas Jr. 3, Rolaids 2

Lahas Jr. vs. Patsy:

Round 1: Both monsters used their full array of attacks, but LJ's were twice of strong and he won 60.7% to 36.8

Round 2: Patsy used several attacks, each doing a small amount of damage, but it was enough to get ahead of Lahas. Unfortunately for Patsy however, a boomerang and a submerge were enough to offset the difference, winning 22 to 18.6

Round 3: LJ simply beat up on Patsy in this round. While not untouched himself, Lahas had more than enough punch to destroy Patsy 63.5 to .04

Lahas Jr. 3, Patsy 0

Lisaione vs. Patsy:

Round 1: Lisa's powerful submerges won it for her again, although not without challenge from Patsy in the 45.5 to 39.2 finish.

Round 2: Still more submerges from Lisa led to another win 60.1 to 42.8

Round 3: Patsy showed that he still had spirit, blocking Lisa's most powerful moves and winning by about 25%

Round 4: Patsy simply performed too many successful techs for Lisa to handle, winning it and tying up the tally

Round 5: Patsy dominated in this round, brutally smashing Lisa with tail whips while managing to dodge all of her techs, winning the round and match 100 to 14.1

Patsy 3, Lisaione 2

This resulted in a 3-way tie, in which Minmei was the tie-breaker.

These were the three monster's percentages of health against Minmei:

1st: Patsy 100%
2nd: Lisa 73.3%
3rd: Lahas Jr. 67.6%

Patsy is the winner! All hail Patsy and Torey! See you at the next tournament MRM!

By torey luvullo on Monday, October 21, 2002 - 03:28 am:

i was very pleasantly surprised by patsy - i was waiting for lisa to finish her sweep when, lo and behold, patsy won...3 times! inconceivable!

btw, fen, in case you are interested, minmei's scores were lower than all the 3 participants in the tie-breaker. minmei is a worthy successor to bones, indeed!

By Deadbuffalo on Monday, October 21, 2002 - 04:50 am:

Strangely enough, those 3 losses were Lisa's only losses for the whole night. Swept both Lahas and beat Minmei. But thats ok, my next (or possibly next next) monster will not allow for the possibility of an upset.
